<p> Sphere is a geometry node, representing a perfectly round geometrical object that is the surface of a completely round ball. <i>Wikipedia:</i> see <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere" target="_blank">Sphere</a>. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Sphere" target="_blank">Sphere</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geometry3D.html" target="_blank">13 Geometry3D component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geometry3D.html#Concepts" target="_blank">13.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geometry3D.html#Sphere" target="_blank">13.3.7 Sphere</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter03Shapes" target="_blank">Chapter 03 Shapes</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter02GeometryPrimitives" target="_blank">Chapter 02 Geometry Primitives</a> </li> </ul>
